questions.title: Software version compliance and updates
questions.content: Have you assessed whether the current software version — and any subsequent updates — continue to comply with the essential cybersecurity requirements under the Cyber Resilience Act, and documented how changes in software versions may affect that compliance?

responses.title: In Progress
responses.description: Work is underway but not yet completed.

questions.title: User instructions (Annex II)
questions.content: Have you created adequate and correct user instructions? (see more in Annex II **Information and Instructions to the User**)

responses.title: In Progress
responses.description: Work is underway but not yet completed.

questions.title: Hardware product identification (photos/markings)
questions.content: Is it a hardware product? If yes have you included photographs or illustrations showing external features, markings and external layout?

responses.title: In Progress
responses.description: Work is underway but not yet completed.

questions.title: Definition of intended purpose of the PDE
questions.content: Have you defined the **intended purpose** of your PDE (product with digital elements)?

responses.title: In Progress
responses.description: Work is underway but not yet completed.

questions.title: Questions - Technical Documentation - Annex VII - Q1
questions.content: ‘Intended Purpose’ means the use for which a product with digital elements is intended by the manufacturer, including the specific context and conditions of use, as specified in the information supplied by the manufacturer in the instructions for use, promotional or sales materials and statements, as well as in the technical documentation

questions.title: Questions - Technical Documentation - Annex VII - Q2
questions.content: Note that the **intended purpose** get's modified we call it **substantial modification** in the cases when:

questions.title: Questions - Technical Documentation - Annex VII - Q3
questions.content: The *cybersecurity risk profile* is modified: adding a new wireless interface, API or cloud integration that wasn't in the original risk assessment

questions.title: Questions - Technical Documentation - Annex VII - Q4
questions.content: The *intended purpose* is modified: smart door updated to handle security camera feeds

questions.title: Questions - Technical Documentation - Annex VII - Q5
questions.content: The *compliance status* is modified: an update disables encryption or changes authentication mechanisms

questions.title: Questions - Technical Documentation - Annex VII - Q6
questions.content: **Repairs, Refurbishments and maintance** are not classified as significant modifications

questions.title: System architecture and design documentation
questions.content: Have you documented the system architecture and design of the product, showing how software components interact and integrate into overall processing?

responses.title: In Progress
responses.description: Work is underway but not yet completed.

questions.title: Questions - Technical Documentation - Annex VII - Q7
questions.content: These can include drawings and schemes

questions.title: Vulnerability handling process and SBOM
questions.content: Have you established and documented your vulnerability handling process, including a software bill of materials, a coordinated vulnerability disclosure policy, and secure update distribution methods? Examples and obligations include:

responses.title: In Progress
responses.description: Work is underway but not yet completed.

questions.title: Questions - Technical Documentation - Annex VII - Q8
questions.content: A generated SBOM listing all third-party and open-source components used in the product.

questions.title: Questions - Technical Documentation - Annex VII - Q9
questions.content: A written policy (published on your website) describing how external researchers can report vulnerabilities.

questions.title: Questions - Technical Documentation - Annex VII - Q10
questions.content: Documented procedures and technical measures ensuring update integrity and authenticity.

questions.title: Questions - Technical Documentation - Annex VII - Q11
questions.content: A documented workflow or ticketing system to record vulnerability reports, triage severity, assign ownership, and track fixes.

questions.title: Questions - Technical Documentation - Annex VII - Q12
questions.content: Reports from penetration testing, static analysis, or fuzzing tools used to detect vulnerabilities.

questions.title: Secure production and monitoring processes
questions.content: Have you described and validated the production and monitoring processes that ensure cybersecurity controls are implemented and maintained during manufacturing? Examples and obligations include:

responses.title: In Progress
responses.description: Work is underway but not yet completed.

questions.title: Questions - Technical Documentation - Annex VII - Q13
questions.content: Description of how the manufacturing environment is protected against tampering or unauthorized access.

questions.title: Questions - Technical Documentation - Annex VII - Q14
questions.content: Procedures showing how product software or firmware integrity is verified before release.

questions.title: Questions - Technical Documentation - Annex VII - Q15
questions.content: Controlled processes for securely injecting keys, credentials, or certificates during production.

questions.title: Questions - Technical Documentation - Annex VII - Q16
questions.content: Continuous monitoring of production systems for anomalies or unauthorized modifications.

questions.title: Questions - Technical Documentation - Annex VII - Q17
questions.content: Evidence that production and monitoring processes have been **tested and validated** for security effectiveness.

questions.title: Questions - Technical Documentation - Annex VII - Q18
questions.content: Mechanisms to trace each product batch or unit back to its production and validation records.

questions.title: Questions - Technical Documentation - Annex VII - Q19
questions.content: **Have you performed and documented a cybersecurity risk assessment** covering the entire lifecycle of the product  (Article 13) — from design and development to delivery and maintenance — and explained **which essential cybersecurity requirements apply** to the product and **how those risks are addressed?** (Part I of Annex I). Note that those risks include:

questions.title: No expoitable vulnerabities
questions.content: Has the product been tested to confirm there are no known exploitable vulnerabilities when placed on the market?

responses.title: In Progress
responses.description: Work is underway but not yet completed.

questions.title: Secure by default
questions.content: Does the product ship with a secure default configuration, including safe default settings and the ability to reset to its original secure state?

responses.title: In Progress
responses.description: Work is underway but not yet completed.

questions.title: Vulnerability and update management
questions.content: Can vulnerabilities be addressed through timely security updates, and are automatic updates enabled by default with clear notifications and user control options?

responses.title: In Progress
responses.description: Work is underway but not yet completed.

questions.title: Protection from unauthorized access
questions.content: Have you implemented authentication, identity, and access control mechanisms to prevent and detect unauthorized access?

responses.title: In Progress
responses.description: Work is underway but not yet completed.

questions.title: Confidentiality of data
questions.content: Is data (personal or otherwise) encrypted at rest and in transit using state-of-the-art methods, and are other technical means used to ensure confidentiality?

responses.title: In Progress
responses.description: Work is underway but not yet completed.

questions.title: Integrity of data and software
questions.content: Are there mechanisms to protect data, programs, and configurations from unauthorized modification, and to detect and report any corruption?

responses.title: In Progress
responses.description: Work is underway but not yet completed.

questions.title: Data minimization
questions.content: Does the product collect and process only the data necessary for its intended purpose, avoiding unnecessary personal or other data?

responses.title: In Progress
responses.description: Work is underway but not yet completed.

questions.title: Availability and resilience
questions.content: Have you implemented measures to ensure essential functions remain available even after incidents, including mitigation against denial-of-service attacks?

responses.title: In Progress
responses.description: Work is underway but not yet completed.

questions.title: Minimizing negative impact on other systems
questions.content: Have you implemented measures to ensure essential functions remain available even after incidents, including mitigation against denial-of-service attacks?

responses.title: In Progress
responses.description: Work is underway but not yet completed.

questions.title: Limiting attack surfaces
questions.content: Have you designed and produced the product to minimize attack surfaces, especially through secure management of external interfaces?

responses.title: In Progress
responses.description: Work is underway but not yet completed.

questions.title: Reducing impact of incidents
questions.content: Are appropriate mechanisms and techniques in place to reduce the impact of cybersecurity incidents?

responses.title: In Progress
responses.description: Work is underway but not yet completed.

questions.title: Monitoring and logging
questions.content: Does the product record and monitor internal activity relevant to security, including access to or modification of data, and allow users to opt out where required?

responses.title: In Progress
responses.description: Work is underway but not yet completed.

questions.title: Secure data deletion and transfer
questions.content: Can users securely erase or transfer personal data and settings, ensuring that this process is done safely and cannot compromise security?

responses.title: In Progress
responses.description: Work is underway but not yet completed.

questions.title: Support period definition for the PDE
questions.content: Have you determined and documented the support period for the product with digital elements (PDE) so that it reflects the expected lifetime of the product, taking into account reasonable user expectations, the product’s intended purpose, relevant Union law on product lifetimes, and comparable support periods for similar products on the market?

responses.title: In Progress
responses.description: Work is underway but not yet completed.

questions.title: Support period justification and external factors
questions.content: Have you also considered factors such as the availability of the operating environment, support periods of integrated third-party components providing core functions, and guidance from the Administrative Cooperation Group (ADCO) or the European Commission, ensuring the support period is proportionate and not less than five years unless the expected use period is shorter?

responses.title: In Progress
responses.description: Work is underway but not yet completed.

questions.title: Questions - Technical Documentation - Annex VII - Q20
questions.content: Note that the ADCO might later specify other support periods for specific product categories where market surveillance indicates inadequate support periods

questions.title: Obligations during support period (Annex I Part II)
questions.content: During the support period have you made sure that ( Annex I Part II ):

questions.title: Vulnerability identification and documentation
questions.content: Have you identified and documented all known vulnerabilities and software components, including by maintaining a **software bill of materials (SBOM)** in a machine-readable format that covers at least top-level dependencies?

responses.title: In Progress
responses.description: Work is underway but not yet completed.

questions.title: Timely remediation and security updates
questions.content: Do you have a process to **address and remediate vulnerabilities without delay**, and, where possible, **provide security updates separately from functionality updates**?

responses.title: In Progress
responses.description: Work is underway but not yet completed.

questions.title: Regular testing and security reviews
questions.content: Are **regular and effective tests, reviews, or audits** performed to evaluate and maintain the security of the product with digital elements?

responses.title: In Progress
responses.description: Work is underway but not yet completed.

questions.title: Public disclosure of fixed vulnerabilities
questions.content: After releasing a security update, do you **share and publicly disclose clear information** about the fixed vulnerabilities — including their impact, severity, affected products, and mitigation guidance — while balancing security risks of early disclosure?

questions.title: Coordinated vulnerability disclosure (CVD) policy
questions.content: Have you established and enforced a **policy on coordinated vulnerability disclosure**, specifying how vulnerabilities are reported, validated, and addressed?

responses.title: In Progress
responses.description: Work is underway but not yet completed.

questions.title: Secure update distribution
questions.content: Have you implemented **secure mechanisms for distributing updates**, ensuring that security patches are delivered, verified, and applied in a **timely and safe** manner?

responses.title: In Progress
responses.description: Work is underway but not yet completed.

questions.title: Free and accessible security updates
questions.content: Are **security updates provided free of charge** and accompanied by **advisory messages** to inform users about the issue, its impact, and any recommended actions to take?

responses.title: In Progress
responses.description: Work is underway but not yet completed.

questions.title: EU Declaration of Conformity (DoC) inclusion
questions.content: Have you included a copy of the EU DoC ( Declaration of Conformity ) ?

responses.title: In Progress
responses.description: Work is underway but not yet completed.

questions.title: Product identification
questions.content: Have you included the **name, type, and any additional information** necessary to uniquely identify the product with digital elements?

responses.title: In Progress
responses.description: Work is underway but not yet completed.

questions.title: Manufacturer details
questions.content: Does the declaration clearly state the **name and address** of the manufacturer or their **authorised representative**?

responses.title: In Progress
responses.description: Work is underway but not yet completed.

questions.title: Provider responsibility
questions.content: Does the declaration contain a **statement confirming** that it is issued **under the sole responsibility of the provider**?

responses.title: In Progress
responses.description: Work is underway but not yet completed.

questions.title: Object of the declaration
questions.content: Have you **identified the object of the declaration**, including sufficient information to ensure **traceability** (e.g., product identifiers, model, or photograph if relevant)?

responses.title: In Progress
responses.description: Work is underway but not yet completed.

questions.title: Conformity statement
questions.content: Does the declaration include a **statement confirming** that the product complies with the **relevant Union harmonisation legislation**?

responses.title: In Progress
responses.description: Work is underway but not yet completed.

questions.title: Applied standards and references
questions.content: Have you listed all **harmonised standards**, **common specifications**, or **cybersecurity certifications** used to demonstrate conformity?

responses.title: In Progress
responses.description: Work is underway but not yet completed.

questions.title: Questions - Technical Documentation - Annex VII - Q21
questions.content: **Notified body and certificate details** (where applicable):  If a **notified body** was involved, have you included its **name, number, description of the conformity assessment procedure**, and **certificate identification**?

questions.title: Additional information and sign-off
questions.content: Does the declaration include any **additional information**, along with the **place and date of issue**, and the **name, function, and signature** of the person authorised to sign on behalf of the manufacturer?

responses.title: In Progress
responses.description: Work is underway but not yet completed.

questions.title: Security test reports for PDE and processes
questions.content: Have you prepared and documented test reports verifying that the product with digital elements and its vulnerability handling processes conform to the applicable essential cybersecurity requirements specified in Parts I and II of Annex I?

responses.title: In Progress
responses.description: Work is underway but not yet completed.

questions.title: SBOM availability for authorities
questions.content: Have you prepared and made available a software bill of materials (SBOM) that can be provided, upon a reasoned request, to a market surveillance authority when necessary for verifying compliance with the essential cybersecurity requirements in Annex I?

responses.title: In Progress
responses.description: Work is underway but not yet completed.

questions.title: Harmonised Standards and Specifications
questions.content: Have you documented all **harmonised standards** applied (in full or in part) whose references are published in the **Official Journal of the European Union** to demonstrate compliance with the essential cybersecurity requirements in Annex I?

responses.title: In Progress
responses.description: Work is underway but not yet completed.

questions.title: Common Specifications and Certification Schemes
questions.content: Have you listed any **common specifications** (as set out in Article 27) or **European cybersecurity certification schemes** (adopted under Regulation (EU) 2019/881) that have been applied, and specified how they contribute to compliance?

responses.title: In Progress
responses.description: Work is underway but not yet completed.

questions.title: Alternative Technical Solutions
questions.content: Where harmonised standards, common specifications, or certification schemes were **not applied or only partly applied**, have you described the **alternative technical solutions** implemented to meet the essential cybersecurity requirements in Annex I , including a list of **other relevant technical specifications** used?

questions.title: Partial Application Clarity
questions.content:
In cases where harmonised standards, common specifications, or certification schemes were **only partially applied**, have you clearly indicated **which parts were applied** in your technical documentation?
